title: ListenNet: A Lightweight Spatio-Temporal Enhancement Nested Network for Auditory Attention Detection
author: Cunhang Fan (Anhui University), Xiaoke Yang (Anhui University), Hongyu Zhang (Anhui University), Ying Chen (Anhui University), Lu Li (Anhui University), Jian Zhou (Anhui University), Zhao Lv (Anhui University), ...
relevance_why: This paper presents an advanced approach to auditory attention detection using EEG signals, which could inform the methodologies in Haohe Liu's work on audio processing tasks.
background: Detecting which speaker a listener is attending to in environments with multiple speakers based on brain signals.
contribution: This paper introduces ListenNet, a lightweight architecture, to solve the challenge of effectively capturing spatio-temporal dependencies in EEG signals, achieving improved detection accuracy while reducing parameter count significantly.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often treated spatial and temporal features separately, leading to inefficiencies in capturing the full context.
technical_comparison.novelty: ListenNet integrates spatio-temporal dependencies and dynamic temporal patterns within a single model framework, enhancing performance and generalization.

key_innovation: Utilizes a combination of Spatio-temporal Dependency Encoder, Multi-scale Temporal Enhancement, and Cross-Nested Attention to effectively model complex temporal relationships in EEG data.
real_world_impact: This approach can enhance applications in smart hearing aids and other auditory-focused technologies, improving user interaction in complex sound environments.
limitations: No specific limitations were mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.Spatio-temporal Dependency Encoder: **Spatio-temporal Dependency Encoder** is a component that captures dependencies in both space and time from EEG signals to improve attention detection.
new_terms.Cross-Nested Attention: **Cross-Nested Attention** refers to an attention mechanism that enhances multi-level feature integration from spatio-temporal data, improving the model's ability to focus on relevant information.
